utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Should we stop the oppression of the world's oldest profession? New York lawmakers are working on a bill -- a bill -- that would decriminalize the sex trade. Lucky bill. utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: When you're talking about consenting adults, I think that, you know, yes. We should really consider that we can't criminalize consensual behavior as long as no one is being harmed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And human rights organizations say decriminalizing sex work would also reduce human trafficking. So could other states do this same thing? utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.sentences: I did it again. All right. Okay. Okay.

utterances.sentences: Here's what I don't understand. Okay. Prostitution, illegal; porn, legal. utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I think that it should absolutely be decriminalized. I don't understand why if you can like sell like a bike, you can't sell your body? It just doesn't make sense to me because you own your own body more than your own -- I've ever owned a bike, it's like totally yours.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: TIMPF

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I don't.

utterances.speaker: DEVITO

utterances.speaker: DEVITO

I think that consenting adults should be allowed to do whatever they want to do as long as they're not harming each other and you know, and at this point, if I were to go to a massage parlor, I'm 50 years old.
